email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is 15-20 October. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s, say $50.75 per metric ton. Let me know your thoughts. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the prompt response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit on the higher side. Given the current market, we were hoping for something in the mid-40s. Could you check if there’s any flexibility? Also, can you confirm the demurrage rate? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I’ve discussed with the owner, and we can adjust the freight rate to $48.50 per metric ton. The demurrage rate is $20,000 per day, pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised quote. The freight rate is more in line with our expectations. However, the demurrage rate is a bit steep. Could we negotiate this down to $18,000 per day? Also, can we confirm the laycan remains 15-20 October? Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner, and we can agree to a demurrage rate of $18,000 per day. The laycan remains 15-20 October. If everything looks good, I can draft the charter party agreement. Let me know. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, that sounds good. Please proceed with drafting the charter party agreement. Let’s finalize the freight rate at $48.50 per metric ton and the demurrage at $18,000 per day. Thanks for your assistance. Best, John
